member.name: M:SwinGame.Audio.OpenAudio
member.summary: Opens the Audio System for SwinGameSDK

member.name: M:SwinGame.Audio.CloseAudio
member.summary: Closes the Audio System for SwinGameSDK

member.summary: Play the indicated sound effect a number of times
member.param: The number of times to play it

member.summary: Play the indicated sound effect a number of times

member.param: Path to the Sound Effect file

member.name: M:SwinGame.Audio.FreeSoundEffect(SwinGame.SoundEffect@)
member.summary: Frees a Sound Effect From Memory
member.param: The effect to be freed from memory

member.name: M:SwinGame.Audio.LoadMusic(System.String)
member.summary: Load music to play from the file system. Music can be in the form of a wav, ogg, or mp3 file.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Audio.FreeMusic(SwinGame.Music@)
member.summary: Free a music value. All loaded music values need to be freed.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Audio.PlayMusic(SwinGame.Music,System.Int32)
member.summary: Play the indicated music effect a number of times The loops paramater can use anything starting from -1, -1 meaning that the sound plays forever
member.param: The number of times to play it

member.name: M:SwinGame.Audio.PlayMusic(SwinGame.Music)
member.summary: Play the indicated music effect a number of times

member.summary: This function checks whether a sound is playing
member.param: The sound effect to check if it is playing

member.name: M:SwinGame.Audio.IsMusicPlaying(SwinGame.Music)
member.summary: This function checks whether music is playing
member.param: The music to check if it is playing

member.summary: Gets the YOffset of the Screen

member.summary: Converts the Vector to Game Coordinates

member.summary: Makes the Camera Follow the Sprite

member.name: M:SwinGame.MappyLoader.CollisionWithMap(SwinGame.Map,SwinGame.Sprite,SwinGame.Vector)
member.summary: Checks if a sprite collides with the map, and if so returns the side of the sprite that collided with the map. This overload allows you to pass in a vector, which describes the movement of the sprite, if the sprites movement vector has not been used.

member.name: M:SwinGame.MappyLoader.CollisionWithMap(SwinGame.Map,SwinGame.Sprite)
member.summary: Checks if a sprite collides with the map, and if so returns the side of the sprite that collided with the map

member.summary: Gets the Number Events of an Event Type on a Map

member.name: M:SwinGame.MappyLoader.EventPositionX(SwinGame.Map,SwinGame.Event,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the Game X Coordinate of the Event

member.name: M:SwinGame.MappyLoader.EventPositionY(SwinGame.Map,SwinGame.Event,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the Game Y Coordinate of the Event

member.name: T:SwinGame.ResourceKind
member.summary:
ResourceKind
Use this with the resource path functions to get the path to a given resource. Using these functions ensures that your resource paths are correct across platforms

member.name: T:SwinGame.Bitmap
member.summary:
Bitmap
The bitmap type is a pointer to a BitmapData. The BitmapData record contains the data used by the SwinGame API to represent bitmaps. You can create new bitmaps in memory for drawing operatings using the CreateBitmap function. This can then be optimised for drawing to the screen using the OptimiseBitmap routine. Also see the DrawBitmap routines.

member.name: P:SwinGame.Vector.x
member.summary: The X Component of the Vector

member.name: P:SwinGame.Vector.y
member.summary: The Y Component of the Vecotr

member.name: P:SwinGame.Vector.w
member.summary: The W Component of the Vector

member.name: T:SwinGame.Core
member.summary:
Core Class
This Classes contains on the Core functionality of the SwinGameSDK

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.OpenGraphicsWindow(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens the graphical window so that it can be drawn onto. You can set the icon for this window using SetIcon. The window itself is only drawn when you call RefreshScreen. All windows are opened at 32 bits per pixel. You can toggle fullscreen using ToggleFullScreen. The window is closed when the application terminates.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.WindowCloseRequested
member.summary: Checks to see if the window has been asked to close. You need to handle this if you want the game to end when the window is closed. This value is updated by the ProcessEvents routine.
member.returns: Returns true if the window has been requested to close

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.ProcessEvents
member.summary: ProcessEvents allows the SwinGame API to react to user interactions. This routine checks the current keyboard and mouse states. This routine must be called frequently within your game loop to enable user interaction.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.SetIcon(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the icon for the window. This must be called before openning the graphics window. The icon is loaded as a bitmap, though this can be from any kind of bitmap file.
member.param: The name of the file to load as the image icon

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.ChangeScreenSize(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the size of the screen.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.ToggleFullScreen
member.summary: Switches the application to full screen or back from full screen to windowed.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.RefreshScreen(System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws the current drawing to the screen. This must be called to display anything to the screen. This will draw all drawing operations, as well as the text being entered by the user.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.RefreshScreen
member.summary: Draws the current drawing to the screen. This must be called to display anything to the screen. This will draw all drawing operations, as well as the text being entered by the user.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.TakeScreenshot(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the current screen a bitmap file. The file will be saved into the current directory.
member.param: The base name for the screen shot

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.GetColor(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the Color when the user enters the amount of red, green, blue and alpha

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.GetColor(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the Color when the user enters the amount of red, green and blue

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.GetFramerate
member.summary: Returns the average framerate for the last 10 frames as an integer.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.GetTicks
member.summary: Gets the number of milliseconds that have passed. This can be used to determine timing operations, such as updating the game elements.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.Sleep(System.UInt32)
member.summary: /// Puts the process to sleep for a specified number of milliseconds. This can be used to add delays into your
member.param: The number of milliseconds to sleep

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.GetPathToResource(System.String,SwinGame.ResourceKind)
member.summary:
Gets the resource to an image, sound, font or other type of resource
Entering ResourceKind.None into the kind parameters makes this function look inside the base resource folder, while entering either, font, image or sound, will make this function look inside their respective folders, image, font and sound folders.
member.param: filename that you need to get the path of
The type of resource it is

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.GetPathToResource(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the Path to a Resource in the base Resource folder.
member.param: filename that you need to get the path of

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.Cos(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the Cos of an angle

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.Sin(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the Sin of an angle

member.name: M:SwinGame.Core.Tan(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the Tan of an angle

member.name: T:SwinGame.Font
member.summary: Fonts are used to render text to bitmaps and to the screen. Fonts must be loaded using the CreateFont routine. Also see the DrawText and DrawTextLines routines.

member.name: T:SwinGame.FontStyle
member.summary: Use font styles to set the style of a font. Setting the style is time consuming, so create alternative font variables for each different style you want to work with. Note that these values can be logical ORed together to combine styles, e.g. BoldFont or ItalicFont = both bold and italic.

member.name: T:SwinGame.FontAlignment
member.summary: Use font alignment for certain drawing operations. With these operations you specify the area to draw in as well as the alignment within that area. See DrawTextLines.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Text.LoadFont(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads a font from file with the specified side. Fonts must be freed using the FreeFont routine once finished with. Once the font is loaded you can set its style using SetFontStyle. Fonts are then used to draw and measure text in your programs.
member.param: The name of the font file to load from the file system
The point size of the font

member.name: M:SwinGame.Text.SetFontStyle(SwinGame.Font,SwinGame.FontStyle)
member.summary: Sets the style of the passed in font. This is time consuming, so load fonts multiple times and set the style for each if needed.
member.param: The font to set the style of
The new style for the font, values can be read together

member.name: M:SwinGame.Text.DrawText(SwinGame.Bitmap,System.String,System.Drawing.Color,SwinGame.Font,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws texts to the destination bitmap. Drawing text is a slow operation, and drawing it to a bitmap, then drawing the bitmap to screen is a good idea. Do not use this technique if the text changes frequently.
member.param: The text to be drawn onto the destination
The color to draw the text
The font used to draw the text
The x location to draw the text at (top left)
The y location to draw the text at (top left)

member.name: M:SwinGame.Text.DrawText(System.String,System.Drawing.Color,SwinGame.Font,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws texts to the screen. Drawing text is a slow operation, and drawing it to a bitmap, then drawing the bitmap to screen is a good idea. Do not use this technique if the text changes frequently.
member.param: The text to be drawn onto the screen
The color to draw the text
The font used to draw the text
The x location to draw the text at (top left)
The y location to draw the text at (top left)

member.name: M:SwinGame.Text.DrawTextLines(System.String,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,SwinGame.Font,SwinGame.FontAlignment,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws multiple lines of text to the screen. This is a very slow operation, so if the text is not frequently changing save it to a bitmap and draw that bitmap to screen instead.
member.param: The text to be drawn onto the destination
The color to draw the text
The color to draw behind the text
The font used to draw the text
The alignment for the text in the region
The x location to draw the text at (top left)
The y location to draw the text at (top left)
The width of the region to draw inside
The height of the region to draw inside

member.summary: Draws multiple lines of text to the destination bitmap. This is a very slow operation, so if the text is not frequently changing save it to a bitmap and draw that bitmap to screen instead.
member.param: The text to be drawn onto the destination
The color to draw the text
The color to draw behind the text
The font used to draw the text
The alignment for the text in the region
The x location to draw the text at (top left)
The y location to draw the text at (top left)
The width of the region to draw inside
The height of the region to draw inside

member.summary: Calculates the width of a string when drawn with a given font.
member.param: The font used to draw the text
member.returns: The width of the drawing in pixels

member.summary: Calculates the height of a string when drawn with a given font.
member.param: The font used to draw the text
member.returns: The height of the drawing in pixels

The y location to draw to
The font used to draw the framerate

member.summary: Array of bitmaps this sprite contains

member.summary: Current animation frame of this sprite

member.name: P:SwinGame.Sprite.UsePixelCollision
member.summary: True if this sprite use pixel collision

member.summary: Gets whether the Sprite Animation has Ended

member.summary: Gets whether the Sprite is reversed

members.member: It is used to determine how a sprite should act.

member.name: F:SwinGame.SpriteKind.StaticSprite
member.summary: StaticSprite will no animate at all.

member.name: F:SwinGame.SpriteKind.AnimArraySprite
member.summary: AnimArraySprite will animate using an array of bitmaps.

member.name: F:SwinGame.SpriteKind.AnimMultiSprite
member.summary: AnimMultiSprite will animate using a single bitmap with multiple frames.

members.member:
Record: SpriteEndingAction
It is used to determine what this sprite should do when it finishes animating.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Graphics.CreateSprite(SwinGame.Bitmap)
member.summary: Creates a sprites, and sets its firat bitmap
member.returns: A new sprite with this bitmap as its first bitmap

member.name: M:SwinGame.Graphics.FreeSprite(SwinGame.Sprite@)
member.summary: Frees a sprite, this does not free the sprite's bitmaps, which allows bitmaps to be shared between sprites. All created sprites need to be freed.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Graphics.AddBitmapToSprite(SwinGame.Sprite,SwinGame.Bitmap)
member.summary: Sprites may contain multiple images. These images can be used for things line animation, facing, etc. This routine adds a bitmap to a sprite, returning the index of the added bitmap.
member.param: the sprite to add the bitmap to
the bitmap to add to the sprite
member.returns: the index of the added bitmap

member.name: M:SwinGame.Graphics.CurrentHeight(SwinGame.Sprite)
member.summary: Returns the current height of the sprite
member.param: The sprite to get the height of
member.returns: The height of the sprite's current frame

member.name: M:SwinGame.Graphics.CurrentWidth(SwinGame.Sprite)

Input Class

member.summary: This function checks if the specified mouse button is being clicked
member.returns: True if the mouse button is being clicked

member.name: M:SwinGame.Input.IsReadingText
member.summary: IsReadingText indicates if the API is currently reading text from the user. Calling StartReadingText will set this to true, and it becomes false when the user presses enter or escape. At this point you can read the string entered as either ASCII or Unicode.
member.returns: True while the API is reading text from the user

member.name: M:SwinGame.Input.TextReadAsASCII
member.summary: TextReadAsASCII allows you to read the value of the string entered by the user as ASCII. See TextReasAsUNICODE, StartReadingText and IsReadingText for more details.
member.returns: The string entered by the user

member.name: M:SwinGame.Input.TextReadAsUNICODE
member.summary: TextReadAsUNICODE returns the string entered by the user as UNICODE. See TextReadAsASCII, StartReadingText, and IsReadingText for more details.
member.returns: The string entered by the user

member.name: M:SwinGame.Input.IsKeyPressed(SwinGame.Keys)
member.summary: Returns true when the key requested is being held down. This is updated as part of the ProcessEvents call. Use the key codes from the KeyCodes unit.
member.returns: True if the key is currently being held down

member.name: M:SwinGame.Input.WasKeyTyped(SwinGame.Keys)
member.summary: Returns true when a key is typed. This occurs when the key is pressed on the keyboard, and will not reoccur until it is released and pressed again. This needs to be checked each ProcessEvents loop.
member.returns: True if the key is pressed

member.returns: True if the sprites have collided.

member.name: M:SwinGame.Physics.CollisionWithinBitmapImages(SwinGame.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,SwinGame.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Performs a collision detection within two bitmaps at the given x, y locations. The bounded values indicate if each bitmap should use per pixel collision detection or a bounded collision detection. This version uses pixel based checking at all times.
When both bitmaps are using bounded collision the routine checks to see if the bitmap rectangles intersect. If one is bounded and the other is pixel based the routine checks to see if a non-transparent pixel in the pixel based image intersects with the bounds of the bounded image. If both are pixel based, the routine checks to see if two non-transparent pixels collide.
Note: Bitmaps do not need to actually be drawn on the screen.
member.param: The bitmap image to check for collision
Indicates if image1 should use bounded collision
The bitmap image to check for collision
Indicates if image2 should use bounded collision

member.name: M:SwinGame.Physics.CollisionWithinBitmapImages(SwinGame.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,SwinGame.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a collision detection within two bitmaps at the given x, y locations using per pixel collision detection. This checks to see if two non-transparent pixels collide.
member.param: The bitmap image to check for collision
The bitmap image to check for collision

member.name: M:SwinGame.Physics.HasSpriteCollidedWithBitmap(SwinGame.Sprite,SwinGame.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if a sprite has collided with a bitmap using pixel level collision detection with the bitmap.
member.param: The sprite to check for collision
The bitmap image to check for collision
The x location of the bitmap
The y location of the bitmap
Indicates if theBitmap should use bounded collision
member.returns: True if the bitmap has collided with the sprite.

member.summary: Determines if a sprite has collided with a bitmap. The x and y values are expressed in "screen" coordinates, with vwPrtX and vwPrtY storing the offset from world to screen coordinates.
member.param: The sprite to check for collision
The bitmap image to check for collision
The x location of the bitmap
The y location of the bitmap
Indicates if bitmap should use bounded collision
The x offset of the screen's portal
The y offset of the screen's portal
member.returns: True if the bitmap has collided with the sprite.

member.param: The sprite to check for collision
The bitmap image to check for collision
The x location of the bitmap

member.returns: True if the bitmap has collided with the sprite.
